subject: Fwd: Merchant  terminal stolen
preview: Hi Natasha, We already had reCaptcha running on the website. We have now upgraded it from V2 to V3, hopefully, this will be able to stop the credit card testing. We have also written a script that w

full_threads.body:
Hi Natasha, 

We already had reCaptcha running on the website. We have now upgraded it from V2 to V3, hopefully, this will be able to stop the credit card testing. 

We have also written a script that will only allow a person to 'check out' up to 5 times within a 24 period. So if a bot does get through, it will only be able to test 5 cards. This will deter the bots. 

We will keep an eye on it over the next few days.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
See below urgent

Sent from my iPhone

Begin forwarded message:

From: Sean Diamond <sean@nicksgroup.com.au>
Date: 23 November 2022 at 11:57:18 am AEDT
To: Jason Ratcliffe <jason@cyren.com.au>, Natasha Kouts <natasha@nicksgroup.com.au>
Cc: James Makarewicz <james@nicksgroup.com.au>, George Manettas <george@nicksgroup.com.au>
Subject: Re: Merchant terminal stolen

﻿
Hi Tash

Can you please get straight onto our web guys about the below email and get their fraud prevention recommendations.

Thanks

Regards,

Sean Diamond
Nicks Restaurant & Bar Group

On 23 Nov 2022, at 11:53 am, Jason Ratcliffe <jason@cyren.com.au> wrote:

﻿

Jason Ratcliffe

Sent from my iPhone

Begin forwarded message:

From: Janelle Eyles <Janelle.Eyles@cba.com.au>
Date: 23 November 2022 at 10:58:06 am AEDT
To: Margaret Staples <mstaples@nicksgroup.com.au>
Cc: Philip Wright <Philip.Wright@cba.com.au>, Jason Ratcliffe <jason@cyren.com.au>
Subject: RE: Merchant terminal stolen

﻿

[ CBA Information Classification: Confidential ]


Hi Margaret / Jason


The Merchant fraud team have advised that your Commweb facility (5353109293865654 belonging to THE HUMBLE FISHMONGER PTY LTD), has been a target of a BIN Attack.


Your website is being targeted by fraudsters to test cards.


It is urgent that you take action to stop this activity and prevent it from reoccurring.


Below are some steps that merchants can take to stop this activity. Please engage your merchant immediately and provide us with their response.

  • The key action is to implement reCAPTCHA on your website. Contact the team managing your website or your Payment Gateway Provider to implement reCAPTCHA.
  • There are step by step guides online on how to enable reCaptcha if you're not sure. Alternatively you can contact your IT support team.

Other actions that should be considered in addition to reCAPTCHA are:

· Consider using 3DS authentication to help protect against fraud.

· Block IPs for Overseas IP/VPN users.

· Block overseas card BINs if customers are based in Australia without overseas-based customers. If you have regular customers from specific countries, for example New Zealand, then block cards from other countries while allowing those from New Zealand.

· Set a minimum transaction value, since BIN attacks tend to involve low value amounts to test cards like $1.00 or $0.01.

· Ensure CVC is captured and validated.

· Risk-based rules to trigger review:

o Analyse time zone differences and browser language consistency from the cardholder's IP address and device.

o Look for multiple tracking elements in a purchase linked to the same device. For example, multiple transactions with different cards, using the same email address and/or same device attributes.

o Look for excessive usage and bandwidth consumption from a single user.

o Velocity checks on transactions as well as velocity checks for low amounts or declined transactions.

Other actions

  1. We recommend you refund/reverse any approved transactions from this BIN in this timeframe.

  1. For Merchant fee enquiries related to the BIN attack transactions, please contact your Relationship Manager or the Merchant Helpdesk 1800 230 177.

For more information on how you can protect yourself from fraud, visit the CommBank website and follow the sections below:

  1. Business
  2. EFTPOS Payments & Ecommerce
  3. Fraud Prevention

What's card testing? (commbank.com.au)

Can you confirm once you have received this email and advise what fraud measures you will be implementing.

If you have any questions please give me a call.




Kind Regards


Janelle Eyles

Transaction Banking Specialist

Transaction Banking (Corporate) NSW

Business Banking

Level 8

Commonwealth Bank Place - South

1 Harbour Street

Sydney NSW 2000

Mobile 0457 612 876

Email janelle.eyles@cba.com.au

To: Margaret Staples <mstaples@nicksgroup.com.au>
Cc: Philip Wright <Philip.Wright@cba.com.au>
Subject: RE: Merchant terminal stolen


[ CBA Information Classification: Confidential ]


Hi Margaret


Are you able to advise if Sean is the best person to liaise with regarding our new Smart Hospitality app?


As per attached email I reached out to Sean a month ago regarding a new Smart Hospitality app available on the Smart Terminals.


I can confirm the app supports the versions of Micros that Nicks Seafood are running.


This would allow your restaurants to integrate the eftpos with the Point of Sale.


We would love the opportunity to discuss this further, can you please advise the best contact person?


In terms of changing the contact name for the Eftpos terminals, did you want this to be amended to Jason's details for all eftpos enquiries? Is so, can you please provide Jason's email address.


Thanks



Kind Regards


Janelle Eyles

From: Margaret Staples <mstaples@nicksgroup.com.au>
Sent: Tuesday, 11 October 2022 3:06 PM
To: Janelle Eyles <Janelle.Eyles@cba.com.au>
Cc: Jason Ratcliffe <jason@cyren.com.au>; Nick Manettas <nickm@nicksgroup.com.au>; Shirley Qin <accounts@nicksgroup.com.au>
Subject: Merchant terminal stolen


⚠ EXTERNAL EMAIL: Do not click links or open any attachments unless you trust the sender and know the content is safe. ⚠


Hi Janelle


I hope you can assist us to replace a stolen terminal urgently at Nicks Seafood. Terminal ID 24711900 was stolen last weekend. Apparently the transactions were saved and paid, however we are missing the terminal. It has been reported but they say only Nick Manettas can order a new one, which we need urgently.


Are you able to send me the form or whatever is needed so we can get this ordered as quickly as possible please?


Regards



MARGARET STAPLES

Office of Nick Manettas

Email: mstaples@nicksgroup.com.au

Tel: 0414879608
